poem:
Cash Isas: A Simple Song  
  
An Isa,  
small vessel of dreams,  
where spare  
pennies rest—   
limit, the quiet  
fence around a park  
grown small.  
  
Still,  
the morning light glints—  
coins catching,  
in their gentle hold,   
the promise  
of a patient  
tomorrow.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Not sure where to start with saving? Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
